input_text:
Job Title: Forklift Operator PR04 ( Line Puller) - 2nd Shift - Waterloo KPR

Location: Waterloo, IA

Employment Type: full-time

Listed Skills: Management, Manufacturing

Description:
Job Details:

Continue growing with our family!  Our team members make it happen. If you want to continue to grow in a new role internally and see a position that looks right for you, we encourage you to apply!  Thanks for your commitment to Tyson Foods!

Waterloo KPR produces fully cooked, ready-to-eat products, and operates six days a week (Mon-Sat). 

This job posting is for 2nd shift with a general work schedule of Monday through Friday and Saturdays as scheduled, 1:45 p.m. to approximately mid-night. The rate of pay is $18.70/hour, plus a shift premium of $.15/hour. Team members must be willing to work overtime and weekends, as needed. This job is eligible for overtime pay.  

Job Responsibilities:

Checks with the Blender Control Operator or Production Supervisor for product to be run during shift Ensures relevant paperwork – raw material analysis sheets – are readily available For species changeover and/or wash downs – ensures Butcher Boy is washed thoroughly and proper Lock-Out/Tag-Out procedures are followed Grinds samples through the Butcher Boy Enters the raw material analysis for each PO# Performs other jobs within the department and provides back-up/breaks to line puller when necessary. Rotates to other jobs in other departments, if needed Accurately completes paperwork and Plant.View entries Uses EIM handheld and software to ship and receive goods Adheres to Tyson Foods policies and procedures in the performance of the job while maintaining a safe work environment for self and others, including personal safety and food safety, and reporting known or suspected violations Performs other duties, as assigned 

Job Requirements:

High School Diploma or General Education Degree (GED) preferred Experience in food manufacturing preferred Basic computer skills to navigate systems and perform data entry. Use of EIM Inventory Control and Plant.View preferred Experience with inventory control methods preferred Accountable to self and others Strong attention to detail, accuracy, and thoroughness Ability to work professionally and respectfully with others while demonstrating positive interpersonal skills Ability to accurately perform math functions: addition, subtraction, multiplication, division Must be willing to work other jobs to meet staffing needs, as needed Must be willing to work weekends and overtime, as needed Ability to report to work as scheduled and work scheduled hours to meet job expectations Must have reliable transportation Ability to identify, act with a sense of urgency, and resolve problems/inconsistencies Ability to climb up and down stairs to get to/from work areas, and work at elevated levels of various heights Requires standing (8-12 hours/day), walking, bending, stooping, twisting, stretching, climbing, pushing, pulling, and reaching above, across, and below, and at shoulder level, and perform repetitive motions Ability to work in an environment where extreme temperatures range seasonally from hot/warm (80-90°F) to cold (20-40°F), where conditions may be damp and/or wet, and concrete floors may be slippery in some areas Ability to lift, carry, push, and pull up to 40 lbs. below waist, at waist level, and above shoulder level Ability to flex/grip with wrists/hands Ability to use a box knife and metal scraper Ability to wear personal protective equipment (PPE), including hard hat, safety glasses, ear protection (plugs or muffs), hair net / beard guard, steel-toed boots, and gloves Monthly and Annual Training Required Safety, HACCP, and HR topics. LOTO and PIT 

Relocation Assistance Eligible:

No

Work Shift: 

B Shift (United States of America)

Hourly Applicants ONLY -You must complete the task after submitting your application to provide additional information to be considered for employment.

Tyson is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, national origin, color, religion, age, genetics, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability or veteran status.

We provide our team members and their families with paid time off; 401(k) plans; affordable health, life, dental, vision and prescription drug benefits; and more.

CCPA Notice. If you are a California resident, and would like to learn more about what categories of personal information we collect when you apply for this job, and how we may use that information, please read our CCPA Job Applicant Notice at Collection, click here.

Experience Level (if available): None

output_json.summary: A full-time position in Waterloo, IA, requiring experience in food manufacturing, basic computer skills, and strong attention to detail.
